availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles H. Mooar (Kenton County, KY, attorney)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, attorney. New Hampshire native. Married to Phoebe Mooar. Father of Charles Mooar, Sarah Mooar, Mary Mooar, and Evie Mooar. Employed by Daniel Mooar as an attorney in Kenton County in 1850. Attorney in Kenton County in 1860. Employed Mary Walker as a servant in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 149B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 5, p. 756.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 132B
Find A Grave, "Charles H. Mooar (1822-1898)," Memorial #78718313, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/78718313 (accessed December 2, 2019).
